member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.ResponseContentTypeHelper.ResolveContentTypeAndEncoding(System.String,System.String,System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Text.Encoding},System.Func{System.String,System.Text.Encoding},System.String@,System.Text.Encoding@)
member.summary: Gets the content type and encoding that need to be used for the response. The priority for selecting the content type is: 1. ContentType property set on the action result 2. property set on 3. Default content type set on the action result
member.remarks: The user supplied content type is not modified and is used as is. For example, if user sets the content type to be "text/plain" without any encoding, then the default content type's encoding is used to write the response and the ContentType header is set to be "text/plain" without any "charset" information.
